description: A JSON object that contains a list of key/value pairs that map from bone name in the specified geometry file (key) to a boolean that tells whether the bone should be visible or not (value).
nodes.name: bone_visibility

description: Determines whether the block is breathable by defining if the block is treated as a `solid` or as `air`. The default is `solid` if this component is omitted.
nodes.name: minecraft:breathability

description: Defines the area of the block that collides with entities. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, the block's collision with entities is disabled. If this component is omitted, default values are used.
nodes.name: minecraft:collision_box

description: Minimal position of the bounds of the collision box. "origin" is specified as [x, y, z] and must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.
nodes.name: origin

description: Size of each side of the collision box. Size is specified as [x, y, z]. "origin" + "size" must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.
nodes.name: size

description: Makes your block into a custom crafting table which enables the crafting table UI and the ability to craft recipes. This component supports only "recipe_shaped" and "recipe_shapeless" typed recipes and not others like "recipe_furnace" or "recipe_brewing_mix". If there are two recipes for one item, the recipe book will pick the first that was parsed. If two input recipes are the same, crafting may assert and the resulting item may vary.
nodes.name: minecraft:crafting_table

description: Defines the tags recipes should define to be crafted on this table. Limited to 64 tags. Each tag is limited to 64 characters.
nodes.name: crafting_tags

description: Specifies the language file key that maps to what text will be displayed in the UI of this table. If the string given can not be resolved as a loc string, the raw string given will be displayed. If this field is omitted, the name displayed will default to the name specified in the "display_name" component. If this block has no "display_name" component, the name displayed will default to the name of the block.
nodes.name: table_name

description: Sets an ordered list of custom component names which are bound in script to be executed upon a block event.
nodes.name: minecraft:custom_components

description: Describes the destructible by explosion properties for this block. If set to true, the block will have the default explosion resistance. If set to false, this block is indestructible by explosion. If the component is omitted, the block will have the default explosion resistance.
nodes.name: minecraft:destructible_by_explosion

description: Sets the explosion resistance for the block. Greater values result in greater resistance to explosions. The scale will be different for different explosion power levels. A negative value or 0 means it will easily explode; larger numbers increase level of resistance.
nodes.name: explosion_resistance

description: Describes the destructible by mining properties for this block. If set to true, the block will take the default number of seconds to destroy. If set to false, this block is indestructible by mining. If the component is omitted, the block will take the default number of seconds to destroy.
nodes.name: minecraft:destructible_by_mining

description: Optional array of objects to describe item specific block destroy speeds, each object contains an 'item' ItemDescriptor and a 'destroy_speed' float. This array currently requires UpcomingFeatures experiment to be enabled.
nodes.name: item_specific_speeds

description: Required.
A destroy speed applied while using the defined 'item'.
nodes.name: destroy_speed

description: Required.
An ItemDescriptor filtering for the item used while mining.
nodes.name: item

description: Sets the number of seconds it takes to destroy the block with base equipment. Greater numbers result in greater mining times.
nodes.name: seconds_to_destroy

description: Specifies the language file key that maps to what text will be displayed when you hover over the block in your inventory and hotbar. If the string given can not be resolved as a loc string, the raw string given will be displayed. If this component is omitted, the name of the block will be used as the display name.
nodes.name: minecraft:display_name

description: Describes the flammable properties for this block. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, or if this component is omitted, the block will not be able to catch on fire naturally from neighbors, but it can still be directly ignited.
nodes.name: minecraft:flammable

description: A modifier affecting the chance that this block will catch flame when next to a fire. Values are greater than or equal to 0, with a higher number meaning more likely to catch on fire. For a "catch_chance_modifier" greater than 0, the fire will continue to burn until the block is destroyed (or it will burn forever if the "destroy_chance_modifier" is 0). If the "catch_chance_modifier" is 0, and the block is directly ignited, the fire will eventually burn out without destroying the block (or it will have a chance to be destroyed if "destroy_chance_modifier" is greater than 0). The default value of 5 is the same as that of Planks.
nodes.name: catch_chance_modifier

description: A modifier affecting the chance that this block will be destroyed by flames when on fire. Values are greater than or equal to 0, with a higher number meaning more likely to be destroyed by fire. For a "destroy_chance_modifier" of 0, the block will never be destroyed by fire, and the fire will burn forever if the "catch_chance_modifier" is greater than 0. The default value of 20 is the same as that of Planks.
nodes.name: destroy_chance_modifier

description: Describes the friction for this block in a range of (0.0-0.9). Friction affects an entity's movement speed when it travels on the block. Greater value results in more friction.
nodes.name: minecraft:friction

description: The description identifier of the geometry to use to render this block. This identifier must either match an existing geometry identifier in any of the loaded resource packs or be one of the currently supported Vanilla identifiers: "minecraft:geometry.full_block" or "minecraft:geometry.cross".
nodes.name: minecraft:geometry

description: The description identifier of the geometry and material used to render the item of this block.
Experimental toggles required: Upcoming Creator Features (in format versions before 1.21.50)
nodes.name: minecraft:item_visual

description: [Required] The "minecraft:geometry" component that will be used for the item.
nodes.name: geometry

description: [Required] The "minecraft:material_instances" component that will be used for the item.
nodes.name: material_instances

description: The amount that light will be dampened when it passes through the block, in a range (0-15). Higher value means the light will be dampened more.
nodes.name: minecraft:light_dampening

description: The amount of light this block will emit in a range (0-15). Higher value means more light will be emitted.
nodes.name: minecraft:light_emission

description: The definitions for how a block behaves when detecting liquid. Only one rule definition is allowed per liquid type - if multiple are specified, the first will be used and the rest will be ignored.
Experimental toggles required: Upcoming Creator Features (in format versions before 1.21.60)
nodes.name: minecraft:liquid_detection

description: Whether this block can contain the liquid. For example, if the liquid type is `water`, this means the block can be waterlogged.
nodes.name: can_contain_liquid

description: The type of liquid this detection rule is for. Currently, `water` is the only supported liquid type. If this field is omitted, `water` will be the liquid type by default.
nodes.name: liquid_type

description: How the block reacts to flowing water. Must be one of the following options:
"blocking" - The default value for this field. The block stops the liquid from flowing.
"broken" - The block is destroyed completely.
"popped" - The block is destroyed and its item is spawned.
"no_reaction" - The block is unaffected; visually, the liquid will flow through the block.
nodes.name: on_liquid_touches

description: When a block contains a liquid, controls the directions in which the liquid can't flow out from the block. Also controls the directions in which a block can stop liquid flowing into it if `no_reaction` is set for the `on_liquid_touches` field. Can be a list of the following directions: "up", "down", "north", "south", "east", "west". The default is an empty list; this means that liquid can flow out of all directions by default.
nodes.name: stops_liquid_flowing_from_direction

description: The path to the loot table, relative to the behavior pack. Path string is limited to 256 characters.
nodes.name: minecraft:loot

description: Sets the color of the block when rendered to a map. The color is represented as a hex value in the format "#RRGGBB". May also be expressed as an array of [R, G, B] from 0 to 255. If this component is omitted, the block will not show up on the map.
nodes.name: minecraft:map_color

description: The material instances for a block. Maps face or material_instance names in a geometry file to an actual material instance. You can assign a material instance object to any of these faces: "up", "down", "north", "south", "east", "west", or "*". You can also give an instance the name of your choosing such as "my_instance", and then assign it to a face by doing "north":"my_instance".
nodes.name: minecraft:material_instances

description: A material instance definition to map to a material instance in a geometry file. The material instance "*" will be used for any materials that don't have a match.
nodes.name: Material Instance

description: Should this material have ambient occlusion applied when lighting? If true, shadows will be created around and underneath the block. Optionally can be constructed with float to control exponent applied to ao value after lighting.
nodes.name: ambient_occlusion

description: Should this material be dimmed by the direction it's facing?
nodes.name: face_dimming

description: The render method to use. Must be one of these options:
"opaque" - Used for a regular block texture without an alpha layer. Does not allow for transparency or translucency.
"double_sided" - Used for completely disabling backface culling.
"blend" - Used for a block like stained glass. Allows for transparency and translucency (slightly transparent textures).
"alpha_test" - Used for a block like the vanilla (unstained) glass. Does not allow for translucency, only fully opaque or fully transparent textures. Also disables backface culling.
nodes.name: render_method

description: Texture name for the material.
nodes.name: texture

description: Sets rules for under what conditions the block can be placed/survive
nodes.name: minecraft:placement_filter

description: List of conditions where the block can be placed/survive. Limited to 64 conditions.
nodes.name: conditions

description: List of any of the following strings describing which face(s) this block can be placed on: "up", "down", "north", "south", "east", "west", "side", "all". Limited to 6 faces.
nodes.name: allowed_faces

description: List of blocks that this block can be placed against in the "allowed_faces" direction. Limited to 64 blocks. Each block in this list can either be specified as a String (block name) or as a BlockDescriptor. A BlockDescriptor is an object that allows you to reference a block (or multiple blocks) based on its tags, or based on its name and states. The fields of a BlockDescriptor are described below.
nodes.name: block_filter

description: The name of a block.
nodes.name: name

description: The list of Vanilla block states and their values that the block can have, expressed in key/value pairs.
nodes.name: states

description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false that can be used to query for blocks with certain tags.
nodes.name: tags

description: Triggers the specified event, either once, or at a regular interval equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range provided.
nodes.name: minecraft:queued_ticking

description: A range of values, specified in ticks, that will be used to decide the interval between times this event triggers. Each interval will be chosen randomly from the range, so the times between this event triggering will differ given an interval_range of two different values. If the values in the interval_range are the same, the event will always be triggered after that number of ticks.
nodes.name: interval_range

description: Does the event loop? If false, the event will only be triggered once, after a delay equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range. If true, the event will loop, and each interval between events will be equal to a number of ticks randomly chosen from the interval_range.
nodes.name: looping

description: The event that will be triggered once or on an interval.
nodes.name: on_tick

description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false. If true on the scheduled tick, the event will be triggered. If false on the scheduled tick, the event will not be triggered.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event that will be triggered.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of the event executed by the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Triggers the specified event randomly based on the random tick speed gamerule. The random tick speed determines how often blocks are updated. Some other examples of game mechanics that use random ticking are crop growth and fire spreading.
nodes.name: minecraft:random_ticking

description: The event that will be triggered on random ticks.
nodes.name: on_tick

description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false. If true on the random tick, the event will be triggered. If false on the random tick, the event will not be triggered.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event that will be triggered.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of the event executed by the block.
nodes.name: target

description: The basic redstone properties of a block; if the component is not provided the default values are used. Requires 1.21.30 format version and above.
Experimental toggles required: Upcoming Creator Features (in format versions before 1.21.30)
nodes.name: minecraft:redstone_conductivity

description: Specifies if redstone wire can stair-step downward on the block.
nodes.name: allows_wire_to_step_down

description: Specifies if the block can be powered by redstone.
nodes.name: redstone_conductor

description: Defines the area of the block that is selected by the player's cursor. If set to true, default values are used. If set to false, this block is not selectable by the player's cursor. If this component is omitted, default values are used.
nodes.name: minecraft:selection_box

description: Minimal position of the bounds of the selection box. "origin" is specified as [x, y, z] and must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.
nodes.name: origin

description: Size of each side of the selection box. Size is specified as [x, y, z]. "origin" + "size" must be in the range (-8, 0, -8) to (8, 16, 8), inclusive.
nodes.name: size

description: The block's translation, rotation and scale with respect to the center of its world position
nodes.name: minecraft:transformation

description: The block's rotation in increments of 90 degrees
nodes.name: rotation

description: The point to apply rotation around
nodes.name: rotation_pivot

description: The block's scale
nodes.name: scale

description: The point to apply scale around
nodes.name: scale_pivot

description: The block's translation
nodes.name: translation

description: Specifies that a unit cube is to be used with tessellation.
nodes.name: minecraft:unit_cube

description: These properties are part of the Block Definition. This helps the system determine how to parse and initialize this block.
nodes.name: Block Definition Properties

description: Specifies the version of the game this entity was made in. If the version is lower than the current version, any changes made to the entity in the vanilla version will be applied to it.
nodes.name: format_version

description: The identifier for this block. The name must include a namespace and must not use the Minecraft namespace unless overriding a Vanilla block.
nodes.name: identifier

description: Event responses for block trigger components.
nodes.name: Block Event Responses

description: Apply mob effect to target.
nodes.name: add_mob_effect

description: The amplifier for the mob effect.
nodes.name: amplifier

description: The duration of the mob effect.
nodes.name: duration

description: The mob effect to apply.
nodes.name: effect

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Deals damage to the target.
nodes.name: damage

description: The amount of damage to deal.
nodes.name: amount

description: The amount of damage to deal if held by a mob.
nodes.name: mob_amount

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: The type of damage to deal.
nodes.name: type

description: Decrement item stack.
nodes.name: decrement_stack

description: Kill target. If target is self and this is run from a block then destroy the block.
nodes.name: die

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Spawns a particle effect relative to target position.
nodes.name: play_effect

description: Particle data value.
nodes.name: data

description: The name of the particle effect to create.
nodes.name: effect

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Play a sound relative to target position.
nodes.name: play_sound

description: The name of the sound to play.
nodes.name: sound

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Removes mob effect from target.
nodes.name: remove_mob_effect

description: The mob effect to remove. Use 'all' to remove all mob effects from target.
nodes.name: effect

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Triggers a slash command or a list of slash commands.
nodes.name: run_command

description: Slash command to run.
nodes.name: command

description: List of slash commands to run.
nodes.name: command array

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Sets this block to another block type.
nodes.name: set_block

description: The type of block to set.
nodes.name: block_type

description: Sets a block relative to this block to another block type.
nodes.name: set_block_at_pos

description: The offset from the block's center.
nodes.name: block_offset

description: The type of block to set.
nodes.name: block_type

description: Sets a block state on this block.
nodes.name: set_block_state

description: Block state to set on the block.
nodes.name: state

description: Spawn loot from block.
nodes.name: spawn_loot

description: File path, relative to the Behavior Pack's path, to the loot table file.
nodes.name: table

description: Event causes the actor to swing.
nodes.name: swing

description: Teleport target randomly around destination point.
nodes.name: teleport

description: Determines if the teleport avoids putting the target in water.
nodes.name: avoid_water

description: Origin destination of the teleport.
nodes.name: destination

description: Determines if the teleport places the target on a block.
nodes.name: land_on_block

description: Max range the target can teleport relative to the origin destination.
nodes.name: max_range

description: The target context to execute against.
nodes.name: target

description: Transforms item into another item.
nodes.name: transform_item

description: Name of the item it should transform into
nodes.name: transform

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_fall_on

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The minimum distance in blocks that an actor needs to fall to trigger this event.
nodes.name: min_fall_distance

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_interact

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_placed

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_player_destroyed

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_player_placing

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_step_off

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target

description: Describes event for this block.
nodes.name: minecraft:on_step_on

description: The condition of event to be executed on the block.
nodes.name: condition

description: The event executed on the block.
nodes.name: event

description: The target of event executed on the block.
nodes.name: target
